intro: Oldenlandia racemosa, commonly known as the "Whorled False Solomon's Seal," is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a raceme, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite and often have a distinctive whitish or pale green midrib. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
